metadata.title: Friday, 19th October, 2018
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

questions.section: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER NO. 31)
parts: (a) which company has been awarded the contract to cull hippos in the Luangwa River in 2018;
(b) whether the culling will impact the tourism industry in the country;
(c) if so, what the impact is;
(d) whether the Government has any plans to cancel the contract in order to preserve the tourism industry; and
(e) whether the Government has culled hippos in the past.

questions.section: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL ANSWER (STANDING ORDER NO. 31)
parts: (a) how many households were displaced in Mpongwe and Masaiti Parliamentary Constituencies in order to pave way for the construction of the Kafulafuta Dam;
(b) whether the Government has any plans to allocate land for farming in the 2018/2019 farming season to the people who were displaced; and

(c) if there are no such plans, why. ORDER OF THE DAY 1 Estimates of Revenue and Expenditure (Including Capital and Constitutional and Statutory Expenditure): Committee of Supply.
